question:
You are a telecommunications engineer who wants to build cell phone towers on a stretch of road. In the reference file is a layout of the road and nearby houses. Each dash, "-", is a marker indicating a mile. Each capital H indicates a house located next to a mile marker, appearing above or below the stretch of road. Each cell phone tower can cover houses located next to the road within a 4-mile radius. Find the minimum number of cell phone towers needed to cover all houses next to the road. Your answer should be a positive numerical integer value.

[Note: There is an attached file at path: /Users/charles/spec_tool_call/gaia_dataset/level1/example_022/389793a7-ca17-4e82-81cb-2b3a2391b4b9.txt]

Each dash, "-", is a marker indicating a mile. Each capital H indicates a house located next to a mile marker, appearing above or below the stretch of road. Each cell phone tower can cover houses located next to the road within a 4-mile radius. Find the minimum number of cell phone towers needed to cover all houses next to the road. Your answer should be a positive numerical integer value.

[Note: There is an attached file at path: /Users/charles/spec_tool_call/gaia_dataset/level1/example_022/389793a7-ca17-4e82-81cb-2b3a2391b4b9.txt]

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to open and read the provided reference file to extract the road and house layout so I can compute the minimum towers needed.
I need to re-read the reference file exactly to count the precise positions of houses relative to mile markers.
I need to load the exact ASCII layout to get precise positions of houses relative to the mile-marker dashes.
I need to read the exact ASCII map from the provided file to determine the precise mile-marker positions of all houses.
I need to read the exact ASCII file to accurately align houses with mile-marker positions and compute coverage.
I need to read the exact ASCII map from the provided file to determine precise mile-marker positions of all houses.

I aligned each H with the mile-marker dashes to get house positions at miles 1, 8, 12, 16, 25, 28, and 30; with a 4-mile radius (coverage interval length 8), a greedy placement covers [1..9], [12..20], and [25..33], so all houses are covered by three towers.

FINAL ANSWER: 3
